abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Romania General
            Cadastre and Land Registration Project was satisfactory, the
            risk to development outcome was moderate, and the Bank and
            borrower performance were both satisfactory. The lessons
            learned were that: 1) a key success factor is the
            establishment of a workable institutional structure, and the
            single agency model works best; 2) the building of public
            confidence in the system and ensuring the public has access
            to the professional support services (notaries, real estate
            agents) is necessary not only for successful implementation,
            but for truly achieving the objective of secure property
            markets; 3) projects may place too high expectations on
            automation and underestimate the complexity of large scale
            IT system development; and 4) sustainability needs to be
            built into project design -- and this is about human capacity.
